org.wildfly.security.auth.provider.jdbc.mapper

Class PasswordKeyMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.auth.provider.jdbc.mapper.PasswordKeyMapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ColumnMapper, KeyMapper

    public class PasswordKeyMapper
extends Object
implements KeyMapper

    A KeyMapper that knows how to map columns from a SQL query to attributes of specific Password type as defined by the algorithm.

    Author:
    Pedro Igor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getAlgorithm()
      Returns the name of the algorithm being used.
      String getCredentialName()
      Returns the credential name supported by this mapper.
      SupportLevel getCredentialSupport(ResultSet resultSet)
      Determine whether a given credential is definitely obtainable, possibly obtainable (for some identities), or definitely not obtainable based on the given ResultSet.
      int getHash()
      Returns an integer representing the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained.
      int getIterationCount()
      Returns an integer representing the column index from where the iteration count (if supported) is obtained.
      int getSalt()
      Returns an integer representing the column index from where the salt (if supported) is obtained.
      Credential map(ResultSet resultSet)
      Maps the given ResultSet to some internal representation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PasswordKeyMapper

        public PasswordKeyMapper(String credentialName,
                         int hash)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - name of the credential which is output of this mapper (will be used to determine algorithm)
        hash - the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if the given algorithm is not supported by this mapper.

      • PasswordKeyMapper

        public PasswordKeyMapper(String credentialName,
                         int hash,
                         int salt)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - name of the credential which is output of this mapper (will be used to determine algorithm)
        hash - the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained
        salt - the column index from where the salt, if supported by the given algorithm, is obtained
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if the given algorithm is not supported by this mapper.

      • PasswordKeyMapper

        public PasswordKeyMapper(String credentialName,
                         int hash,
                         int salt,
                         int iterationCount)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - name of the credential which is output of this mapper (will be used to determine algorithm)
        hash - the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained
        salt - the column index from where the salt, if supported by the given algorithm, is obtained
        iterationCount - the column index from where the iteration count or cost, if supported by the given algorithm, is obtained
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if the given algorithm is not supported by this mapper.

      • PasswordKeyMapper

        public PasswordKeyMapper(String credentialName,
                         String algorithm,
                         int hash)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - name of the credential which is output of this mapper
        algorithm - the algorithm that will be used by this mapper to create a specific Password type
        hash - the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if the given algorithm is not supported by this mapper.

      • PasswordKeyMapper

                         String algorithm,

                         int salt)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
        Constructs a new instance.

        algorithm - the algorithm that will be used by this mapper to create a specific Password type
        hash - the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained
        salt - the column index from where the salt, if supported by the given algorithm, is obtained
        Throws:

      • PasswordKeyMapper

        public PasswordKeyMapper(String credentialName,
                         String algorithm,
                         int hash,
                         int salt,
                         int iterationCount)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
        Constructs a new instance.
        Parameters:
        credentialName - name of the credential which is output of this mapper
        algorithm - the algorithm that will be used by this mapper to create a specific Password type
        hash - the column index from where the password in its clear, hash or encoded form is obtained
        salt - the column index from where the salt, if supported by the given algorithm, is obtained
        iterationCount - the column index from where the iteration count or cost, if supported by the given algorithm, is obtained
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if the given algorithm is not supported by this mapper.

      • getCredentialSupport

        public SupportLevel getCredentialSupport(ResultSet resultSet)
        Description copied from interface: KeyMapper

        Determine whether a given credential is definitely obtainable, possibly obtainable (for some identities), or definitely not obtainable based on the given ResultSet.

        In this case the support is defined based on the query result, usually related with a specific account.

        Specified by:
        getCredentialSupport in interface KeyMapper
        Parameters:
        resultSet - the result set
        Returns:
        the level of support for a credential based on the given result set
